original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in need for DDR clarity
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in mid day trade on Thursday on a wait and see approach for further clarity on debt restructuring and optimization’s from the government’s perspective.
“Wait and see approaches have been adopted, looking for clearance and clarity on debt restructuring,” an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was down 0.19 percent or 16.40 points to 8,806.88, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 1.01 percent or 25.68 points to 2,513.49.
The turnover was slow and weak, the market generated a revenue of 373 million rupees at 1230 hours.
Top losers were John Keells Holdings, Commercial Bank and Ceylon Tobacco Company. (Colombo/May18/2023)
